oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Circular order from the Treasury Department to the Officers of the Customs announcing the insurrection in Tennessee is suppressed
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Equipment and supplies; McCullough, Hugh, 1808-1895; Confederate States of America -- Army -- Uniforms
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Circular letter permitting resumption of shipments except for arms, ammunition, and related items into Tennessee. The letter is signed by Secretary of the Treasury H. McCulloch.
Note that one of the exceptions in shipping would be gray cloth that might be used to produce Confederate uniforms.
